clues.text: In 2000 Sila Calderon, San Juan's mayor, was elected this island's first female governor
Barbados was known to be good for those suffering from diseases of these organs; George's brother Lawrence Washington tried it
Juan Pablo Duarte worked to free what is now this country from Haiti; independence was declared in 1844
Until 1973 this country was known as British Honduras
In 1636 Aruba was colonized by this country & occupied by its West India Company
Before the closing of the theaters in 1642, James Shirley wrote about 30 plays during the reign of this king
"We Have Always Lived in the Castle" is a Gothic novel by this author also known for her short stories
This Welsh singer sang the theme songs for 3 James Bond movies
In the miniseries "Mrs. America" about 1970s feminist wars, Uzo Aduba played this pioneering Black presidential candidate
Post-Hollywood, Shirley Temple served as a U.S. ambassador & head of the office of this, diplomatic procedure
For every action there's an equal & opposite reaction, according to Newton's third law of this
The Little Dipper is part of this constellation
The saltwater one of these reptiles grows up to about 20 feet long; the dwarf one of Africa, up to about 6 feet
Among other things, these chemical substances secreted by certain animals are used to mark territory & to attract mates
The echidna & duck-billed platypus belong to this order of mammals whose name is from Latin & means "one opening"
Jamal wins 20 million rupees after getting the final question right in this 2008 movie
In "Brave", Merida discovers a loophole & "wins" her own hand in marriage through a contest in this sport
In a 1994 film this character receives a Medal of Honor from LBJ after being wounded "in the buttocks"
In "Never Say Never Again", this Bond actor settles for a dance with Kim Basinger after winning a game vs. the villainous Largo
At the end of a 2009 movie this title guy is offered his dream job but instead continues to protect shoppers at the West Orange Pavilion

rounds.comments: (Ken: You'll need to name each literary work from the last line.)

clues.text: "He had won the victory over himself. He loved Big Brother"
"God bless us, every one!"
"It was the devious-cruising Rachel, that in her retracing search after her missing children, only found another orphan"
"Aunt Sally she's going to adopt me and sivilize me and I can't stand it. I been there before"
"Oh, my girls, however long you may live, I never can wish you a greater happiness than this!"
In a 1435 essay Leon Battista Alberti declared that an art renaissance was occurring in this city of Leonardo
After seeing a painting by Monet, critic Louis Leroy derisively gave this movement its name
Lawrence Alloway is credited with this 2-word term for work that uses comic strips, soup cans & the like as subject matter
Christopher Knight criticizes museums as shortsighted for funding operations by selling art--in museum-speak, this "de"-verb
Clement Greenberg said the 1943 work "Mural" showed this man was the greatest painter the U.S. had produced
As the name implies, even for a giant company it can be a single page showing a business' assets & liabilities
If rate of yield fails to increase in proportion to investment beyond a certain point, you get these declining 2-word profits
It's the horticultural term for a largely unregulated private partnership group using speculative investment strategy
As the name suggests, when buying a home it's a deposit paid to the seller to demonstrate a buyer's good faith
Some traders specialize in this, the simultaneous buying & selling of the same asset at different prices in different markets
This sister of Rumer & Tallulah Willis was named for a character in "To Kill a Mockingbird"
The daughter of Michelle Williams & Heath Ledger is named for this Roald Dahl book
In the U.S., this first name from "Gone with the Wind" is more often given to girls, but boy band & Broadway star Parker Angel has it
Dwayne Johnson named a daughter this, also the first Black Disney princess
Known for period dramas like George Eliot adaptations, actress Garai has this first name of an Eliot title character
Intelligent streetcars
A guanaco relative's shopping complex
An eager female opera star
A sleepy scimitar
A Papeete porkpie

rounds.category: FROM THE MOUNTAINS TO THE PRAIRIES

clues.text: In 1865 Peak XV got this new name to honor a British surveyor general of India
Prairie du Chien, this state's oldest settlement after Green Bay, was the site of the state's only battle in the War of 1812
Kansas' Little House on the Prairie Museum was reconstructed from the descriptions of this woman
Uranium City, where folks once mined just what you'd think, is in this middle one of Canada's prairie provinces
The polar section of this mountain range ends near the Kara Sea; the southern part, around Kazakhstan's border
Laundry tubs & sausage casing were part of Willem Kolff's WWII-era artificial this organ, precursor to the dialysis machine
In 1893 Marie Tucek invented an early version of this metallic support system in brassieres
Working at Kodak in the 1970s, Steven Sasson invented this device that became the company's ruination
Yoshitada Minami put an automatic turn-off on this kitchen device & in 4 years, half of Japanese homes had one
Reading about this group's fate in 1840s California spurred Gail Borden to invent a dried meat biscuit, & then condensed milk

rounds.text: Of Cecil B. De Mille's 70 films, only this non-Biblical one won "Best Picture"
